page.title: 19INDUSTRY IN SALISBURY
page.content: Main employer,{Health Authority}other employment in Service industries in central business district,especially insurance.{National Headquarters of {United Kingdom Provident.}Retail trade provides many jobs as Salisbury is the catchment area for 250,000 shoppers. For a small market town there is an exceptionally varied range of shops including many of the major chains,for example Boots and Marks and Spencer. Older commercial premises in city centre converted to retail outlets. Increasing amount of light specialised industries on purpose-built industrial estates on edges of city,{electronics {and new technologies predominate. Hi- {Tech firms}attracted by good working conditions and stable population to supply labour force. Historically no industrial base,mainly rural area. {Unemployment figures generally low.
